$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.title: $:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog/deleteNodeDialog
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.subtitle: {{$:/core/images/delete-button}} You are about to delete <<count>> nodes
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.text:
\rules except wikilink ''Please choose an option or abort:'' <$radio tiddler=<> field="delete-from" value="system"> Delete nodes from system [1]
<$radio tiddler=<> field="delete-from" value="filter"> Delete nodes from graph's filter [2] The following nodes will be deleted:
    <$list filter=<>>
  • <$view tiddler={{!!title}} field="title" />
--- [1] This will delete all nodes, their corresponding tiddlers and all connected edges.
[2] ''Important:'' Removing a node from the graph's filter only works, if the node has been added in the map editor per double click or via "Add Node". If the node hasn't been added as mentioned above, you need to change the underlying tiddler in a way that it doesn't match your filter anymore, if you don't want it to be displayed in the graph.

$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.title: $:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog/dublicateIdInfo
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.subtitle: {{$:/core/images/info-button}} Dublicate id detected
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.text:
\rules except wikilink TiddlyMap requires the value of the id field ("tmap.id") to be unique in order to correctly identify nodes and tiddlers. The id of the "<>" already exists for these tiddlers:
    <$list filter=<> variable="item">
  • <$link><>
Therefore TiddlyMap * assigned a new id to tiddler "<>" * removed all edges from "<>"

$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.title: $:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog/edgeNotVisible
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.subtitle: {{$:/core/images/info-button}} Edge will not be visible in view "<<view>>"
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.text:
\rules except wikilink You just created an edge of type <$text text=<> /> that will not be visible in this view because it doesn't match your edge-type filter settings. The current edge-type filter of view "<>" looks like this: 
<$text text=<> />
To have the newly added type displayed in your view, adjust your edge-type filter accordingly. Some suggestions:
  • Explicitly add the type to the filter: <$text text="[[" /><$text text=<> /><$text text="]]" />
  • <$set filter="[regexp[:]splitbefore[:]]" name="prefix" emptyValue=<>> Add a filter rule (e.g. a prefix filter) that will match your type: [prefix[<>]]
  • Make your current view-filter less restrictive.
For further information, please see: [[Node and edge-type filters|http://tiddlymap.org#Node%20and%20edge-type%20filters]].

$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.title: $:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog/fieldChanged
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.subtitle: {{$:/core/images/info-button}} The field "<<name>>" changed
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.text:
\rules except wikilink

You changed the field "<<name>>" from "<<oldValue>>" to "<<newValue>>".

It is recommended to let TiddlyMap copy all values from the former field "<<oldValue>>" to the new field "<<newValue>>" so the data stored in "<<oldValue>>" is not lost. This operation has to be done now or never.

Do you want to move each tiddler's existing "<<oldValue>>" value to "<<newValue>>"? Please note that any value currently stored in "<<newValue>>" would consequently be overridden and the old field "<<oldValue>>" would be eventually removed!

$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.subtitle: {{$:/core/images/info-button }} Welcome
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.text: \rules except wikilink It seems that you freshly installed TiddlyMap. * In case you need any help, please consult the [[online docs|http://tiddlymap.org#Documentation]] first. * You are welcome to create an [[issue|https://github.com/felixhayashi/TW5-TiddlyMap/issues]] at GitHub for any bug you discover. * Make sure to revisit the [[demo site|http://tiddlymap.org]] to see whether your version is up-to-date. * If you like TiddlyMap, please give it a star at [[GitHub|https://github.com/felixhayashi/TW5-TiddlyMap]] or tell your friends about it :) * ''Please note:'' TiddlyMap is distributed under the [[BSD 2-Clause License|http://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-2-Clause]], which belongs to the same license family, as the license used by TiddlyWiki. By using this plugin you agree to the product's [[License Terms|https://github.com/felixhayashi/TW5-TiddlyMap/blob/master/LICENSE]]. Enjoy! --- TiddlyMap will configure your wiki for optimal use. Everything can be changed back later by you, via the TiddlyWiki configurations panel, so no worries. If you checked some of the options below, please save & restart after closing this dialog. <> <> <> <>

$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.title: $:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog/widgetCodeGenerator
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.subtitle: {{$:/core/images/permalink-button}} Widget Code Generator
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.text:
\rules except wikilink
Use the code below to embed a view in a tiddler. 
<$tmap

<$list filter="[has[var.view]]">
  view="<$view field='var.view' />"
<$list filter="[field:var.click-to-use[true]]">
  click-to-use="true"
<$list filter="[has[var.editor]]">
  editor="<$view field='var.editor' />"
<$list filter="[has[var.width]]">
  width="<$view field='var.width' />"
<$list filter="[has[var.height]]">
  height="<$view field='var.height' />"
<$list filter="[has[var.class]]">
  class="<$view field='var.class' />"
<$list filter="[field:var.show-buttons[false]]">
  show-buttons="false"
<$list filter="[has[var.design]]">
  design="<$view field='var.design' />"></$tmap>
Parameters <$macrocall type="input-select" $name="tmap-row" title="View" field="var.view" nochoice=" " selectFilter=<> descr="The view to bind the wiedget to" /> <> <> <> <> <> <> <>

$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.title: $:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialogFooter/ok_suppress
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/dialog.text:
\rules except wikilink

<$set name="currentTiddler" value=<<title>> >

<$checkbox field="suppress" checked="1" unchecked="0" default="0"> Do not show this dialog again</$checkbox>
<$button class="tmap-dialog-button tmap-ok-button" tooltip="Confirm this dialog">OK

</$button>

</$set>

$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/icon.text:
<svg
   xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/"
   xmlns:cc="http://creativecommons.org/ns#"
   xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#"
   xmlns:svg="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
   xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
   xmlns:inkscape="http://www.inkscape.org/namespaces/inkscape"
   class="tc-image-tiddlymap-button tc-image-button"
   version="1.1"
   width="22pt"
   height="22pt"

$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/misc/m.title: $:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/misc/macros
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/misc/m.text:
\define concat(str) $str$ \define input-text(field, index, default, readonly, class, focus) <$reveal type="match" text="" default="$readonly$"> <$edit-text tiddler=<> field="$field$" index="$index$" type="text" tag="input" default="$default$" focus="$focus$" class="$class$" /> <$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="$readonly$"> \end \define input-button(field, index, default, default, label:"Proceed")
<$button>$label$ <$action-setfield $tiddler=<> $field="$field$" index="$index$" $value="$default$" />
\end \define input-textarea(field, index, default, default, class, focus) <$edit-text tiddler=<> field="$field$" index="$index$" autoHeight="no" type="text" tag="textarea" default="$default$" class="$class$" focus="$focus$" /> \end \define input-checkbox(field, index, readonly, default) <$reveal type="match" text="" default="$readonly$"> <$checkbox tiddler=<> field="$field$" index="$index$" checked="true" unchecked="false" default="$default$" /> <$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="$readonly$"> \end \define input-multi-checkbox(selectFilter, invert:"no", default)
<$list filter="$selectFilter$" emptyMessage="– This list contains no items –"> <$checkbox tiddler=<> tag=<>> <$view tiddler=<> field="title" />
\end \define input-select(field, index, selectFilter, default, nochoice) <$select tiddler=<> field="$field$" index="$index$" default="$default$"> <$set name="nochoice" value="$nochoice$"> <$list filter="[regexp[.+]]"> <$list filter="$selectFilter$"> \end \define input-radio(field, index, selectFilter, default) <$list filter="$selectFilter$"> <$radio tiddler=<> field="$field$" index="$index$" value=<>> <>
\end \define tmap-row(title, field, index, type, descr, note, label, default, readonly, reset, selectFilter, nochoice, invert, class, focus) $title$: <<$type$ field:"$field$" index:"$index$" readonly:"$readonly$" default:"$default$" label:"$label$" invert:"$invert$" selectFilter:"$selectFilter$" nochoice:"$nochoice$" focus:"$focus$" class:"$class$">> <$reveal type="match" text="true" default="$reset$"> <$button>reset <$action-setfield $tiddler=<> $field="$field$" $index="$index$" $value="$default$" /> $descr$ <$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="$note$">
''Note:'' $note$
\end \define visConfiguration(inheritedList, extensionField, styleName:"style")
Visjs configurations ($styleName$)
Only config items that you actually changed have an effect on the graph. Other options are visible, yet, inactive.
<$tmap-config mode="manage-node-types" inherited="$inheritedList$" extension="$extensionField$" />
\end

$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/graph/.title: $:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/graph/nodeTypes/tmap:central-topic
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/graph/.description: The style is applied to the node that you marked as central topic in a map.

$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/graph/.title: $:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/graph/nodeTypes/tmap:neighbour
$:/plugins/felixhayashi/tiddlymap/graph/.description: Neighbours are all nodes that are not part of the original set of nodes ("matches") but are connected (either outgoing or incoming) to a node of the original set.
